intro: Anemia presliana, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Anemia presliana typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its botanical features make it well adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
